intro: Strophostyles helvola var. missouriensis, commonly known as the Missouri helvola, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with slender, elongated lobes, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
